description: From Middle English imperturbable, from Middle French imperturbable and directly from Late Latin imperturbābilis, from im- + perturbō + -bilis. Surface analysis im- + perturbable.

adjectives.description: imperturbable (comparative more imperturbable, superlative most imperturbable)

entries.meaning: Not easily perturbed, upset or excited.
Calm and collected, even under pressure.
